cheml.wrappers.base module¶

cheml.wrappers.base.BANK()¶
class cheml.wrappers.base.BASE(Base, parameters, iblock, Task, Function, Host)¶

Bases: object

Do not instantiate this class

Fit_sklearn()¶
IO()¶
Receive()¶
Send()¶
data_check(token, X, ndim=2, n0=None, n1=None, format_out='df')¶
Tasks:
  • check the dimension and size of input
  • change the format from numpy array to pandas data frame or vice versa
Parameters:
  • X – numpy.ndarray or pandas.DataFrame input data
  • token – string name of input (e.g. training input)
  • ndim – integer, optional (default=2) X.ndim; valid digits are 1 and 2
  • n0 – int number of data entries
  • n1 – int number of features
  • format_out – string (‘df’ or ‘ar’), optional (default = ‘df’)

:return input data converted to array or dataframe :return the header of dataframe

if input data is not a dataframe return None

required(token, req=False)¶
Tasks:
  • check if input token is required
Parameters:
  • token – string, name of the input
  • req – Boolean, optional (default = False)

class cheml.wrappers.engine.Parser(script)¶

Bases: object

script: list of strings
A list of lines in the cheml script file.
fit()¶

The main funtion for parsing cheml script. It starts with finding blocks and then runs other functions.

Returns:

cmls: cheml script

transform(cmls)¶
goals:
  • collect all sends and receives
  • check send and receive format.
  • make the computational graph
  • find the order of implementation of functions based on sends and receives
Parameters:cmls –
Return implementation order:
 
class cheml.wrappers.engine.Settings(output_directory='CMLWrapper.out', InputScript_copy=True)¶

Bases: object

makes the output directory.

output_directory: String, (default = “CheML.out”)
The directory path/name to store all the results and outputs
input_copy: Boolean, (default = True)
If True, keeps a copy of input script in the output_directory

output_directory
